title: Michael van Gerwen sets Champions League target after World Grand Prix triumph
text:
Michael van Gerwen claimed his fifth World Grand Prix title on Saturday night (Picture: Lawrence Lustig)

Michael van Gerwen is already eyeing up his next piece of silverware after winning the World Grand Prix for a fifth time on Saturday night.

The world number one beat Dave Chisnall 5-2 in an excellent final in Dublin as MVG retained the Grand Prix title for the first time.

Van Gerwen pocketed £110,000 for his efforts while Chisnall had to settle for the £50,000 runners-up prize in his second run to the final of the double-in event.

It has been another outrageously successful year so far for Mighty Mike, who adds the Grand Prix title to the World Championship, Masters and Premier League, along with a string of ProTour, European Tour and World Series victories.

He now has his focus firmly set on the Champions League of Darts later this month (19-20 Oct in Leicester), which is a rare event for the fact that Van Gerwen has never won it before.

‘It means a lot to me and I’m really pleased with this victory,’ said Van Gerwen after beating Chizzy.

‘It’s been a phenomenal week for me and I played really well, and it was a really good performance in the final because Dave put me under pressure. This was some of the best darts I’ve seen from Dave and he never gave in.

‘He had a great tournament and he played really well and pushed me, but every time in the important moments I did the right thing – and I think going 3-1 up was a big moment.

‘I feel good and I want to keep this form going now into the big tournaments we have coming up.

‘Everyone writes me off, but when I put in a performance like that it means a lot.

‘I’ve never won that [the Champions League] so it’s going to be an important one, it’s on my bucket list. So I need to make sure I keep my focus for a few days.’

So happy to win this title for the fifth time. It is a special one for me. Dave Chisnall is a quality player and threw a lot at me in the final but tonight and all week I have been good in the big moments – and that's why I am holding the trophy again 🏆https://t.co/tDWwSJcVWF — Michael Van Gerwen (@MvG180) October 12, 2019

The five-time Grand Prix champ added on Twitter: ‘So happy to win this title for the fifth time. It is a special one for me. Dave Chisnall is a quality player and threw a lot at me in the final but tonight and all week I have been good in the big moments – and that’s why I am holding the trophy again.

‘I also want to say thank you to an amazing crowd in Dublin. The atmosphere was electric tonight and I think we made fantastic final for everyone watching there and at home.

Thanks also to my family, friends, management, sponsors & my fans. Your support helps me do this.’

The victory for the Dutchman continues his vice-like stranglehold on the world number one spot which he has held since winning the World Championship on 1 January 2014.

Van Gerwen takes his two-year winnings to £1,679,750 on the Order of Merit, with world number two Rob Cross lagging behind on £928,750 and then another significant gap to Gary Anderson on £546,500 at number three.
